meanings.definition: A person who has an extreme or irrational fear or aversion to something.
meanings.sent1: Many phobics are terrified of spiders.
meanings.sent2: The support group was filled with phobics sharing their experiences.
meanings.sent3: The phobics at the haunted house screamed louder than the actors.
meanings.sent4: Her friend was a phobics magnet, attracting all their fears.
meanings.sent5: The therapist helped the phobics face their fears head-on.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of phobics.
meanings.sent1: The phobics behavior was noticeable in crowded places.
meanings.sent2: She designed a phobics-friendly environment for the event.
meanings.sent3: The phobics cat refused to go near the water bowl.
meanings.sent4: The phobics clouds seemed to follow him wherever he went.
meanings.sent5: The phobics tendencies were evident in her avoidance of elevators.
